title: Ashe's ult should visually freeze her target like Sejuani's does
body:
^

Works both for thematic reasons and clarity

replies.body:
{{champion:22}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:127}} 

All have ults that do the exact same thing, but Ashes is the only one that doesn't look pretty.
Ironically, she's the only one that is pretty. :P
Sejuani is a babe... it's Bristle that's sort of ugly, but I love him anyways.
Oh look it's a fat pig...riding a boar.

Umm... Sejuani isn't even 'thick' in the pictures, much less a 'fat pig'.

She SHOULD be thick, almost Amazonian really, for her concept... but that's not how they drew her.

She should be a Breean (or how ever you spell her name for GoT), a large hulking lady... or all Princess Warrior/Chyna... seeing how she has a shield, a huge flail, and rides a boar... but again, not how the actually depict her.

She has a thin waist every time my screen loads up and I proceed to destroy enemies with her.
He was quoting a video called "Rammus taunts everyone," I believe.

Well then...

I'M A STEGOSAURUS!

"Hello mine turtle!"

HELLO!
EVERYBODY DO THE FLOP!
DON'T JUMP YOU HAVE SO MUCH TO LIVE FOR!
DESMOND THE MOON BEAR!
THE SCIENCE SHOW!
PIANO!
Classic.
Oh boy what flavor?
I BAKED YOU A PIE!!!!!
"Oh look, a merry-go-round."
Some people just don't bulk up, it's possible Sejuani is one of them.  It just doesn't prevent her from trampling her enemies to dust.
*Briene

I find sejuani MUCH more gorgeous than ashe, abit rough on the edges but a softy lonely person inside, after all  she spent her whole life on a miserable cold tundra ALL alone, meanwhile ashe was like royalty

And i don't think you've read Ashe's lore nor understood Sejuani's.

liked just cuz ashe is sexy

> [{quoted}](name=TrustworthyDude,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fExxicTZ,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-02-05T20:47:01.923+0000)
>
> NOW PEOPLE, LISTEN: I have been saying this for a while... if Ashe's ult hits someone and kills them, it should keep on going; maybe with reducing damage upon each kill, but it should continue nonetheless! This is a genius idea...who's with me???

the problem wit this is Ashe's ult is meant to be used as utlility and not to be held during fights so u can KS kills. . .this logic is why ashe players loose team fights. they ignore the stun and use it as an execute.

Even as an ADC, I'd rather get 5 Assists and an ACE than 1 Kill.

I almost always use my Arrow for the Team Engage.  Followed by using it to pick Mid Lane from Bot so my Assassin or Jungle can get the Kill and snow ball.

Followed lastly by trying to snipe some one at No HP trying to flee, which means my team did a great job Engaging without needed my Arrow.  Which is why it's my least used, most Teams won't do a good Engage.

The problem with Ashe is that her ult encourages her to engage when it's up to the tank to make the calls and start a team fight.

I think that if Ashe's ult kills someone it should create an effect that allows it to continue CCing people, whether it continues to the next person or makes the entire explosion stun (I wouldn't find it very OP especially if it was a reduced amount as it's generally hard to get kills with it in the first place, and it would require her to save it till the second half of the teamfight when it could be used earlier for much more)
This is honestly a buff to AP Ashe and pretty much no change to ADC Ashe. The damage on the arrow sucks. It's used for the stun/slow, not the damage.
So, in other words, you like to derail Ashe threads.
Savage

Not really. Ashe shoots an arrow made of ice that shatters on impact. It doesn't stun the target by freezing them, it stuns them because it's a large, cold explosion right in their face. Sejuani throws a magic bola that actually lowers the temperature of everything in the area to freeze them in blocks of ice.

It's the difference between hail and freezing rain.

Sejuani throws a magic bola that actually lowers the temperature of everything in the area to freeze them in blocks of ice.

true
There was a LoL cinematic or animation where an Ashe ult encased the victim in ice. I've always imagined it like that
